A 17-years-old boy presented with TLC of 138x 109/L with 80% blasts on the peripheral smear. Chest X-ray demonstrated a large mediastinal mass. Immunophenotyping of this patient’s blasts would most likely demonstrate-

options.label: B
options.text: An immature T cell phenotype (Tdt CD34/CD7 positive)

options.label: C
options.text: Myeloid markers, such as CD13, CD33 and CD15

options.label: D
options.text: B cell markers, such as CD19, CD20 and CD22

questions.correct_answer: B. An immature T cell phenotype (Tdt CD34/CD7 positive)

A 60-years-old man presented with fatigue, weight loss and heaviness in left hypochondrium for 6 months. The hemo-gram showed Hb=10 gm/ dL, TLC 5 lakhs/mm3, platelet count 4 lakhs/mm3, DLC neutrophil 55% lymphocytes 4% monocytes 2% basophils 6% metamyelocytes 10%, myelocytes 18%, promyelocytes 2% and blasts 3%. The most likely cytogenetic abnormality in this case is:

A 50-years-old man presents with fatigue and easy bruising. A complete blood count and peripheral blood smear show leucocytosis with 56% circulating blasts. The patient has no previous history of myeloid neoplasm or treatment with hemotherapy. Which of the following findings would definitively establish a diagnosis of acute myeloid leukemia?

options.label: A
options.text: Presence of blasts with deeply basophilic and vacuolated cytoplasm

options.label: B
options.text: Presence of Auer rods in the blasts

options.label: C
options.text: Presence of small blasts with round nuclei, variably dispersed chromatin, occasional nucleoli and scant amounts of basophilic cytoplasm

options.label: D
options.text: Presence of large blasts with round nuclei, dispersed chromatin prominent nucleoli and abundant basophilic cytoplasm

questions.correct_answer: B. Presence of Auer rods in the blasts

Which of the following statements regarding acute promyelocytic leukemia with PML-RARA is the most correct?

options.label: A
options.text: The disease shows a poor response to treatment

options.label: B
options.text: The disease is almost always preceded by chronic myelogenous leukemia

options.label: C
options.text: Patients are at high risk for the development of disseminated intravascular coagulation

options.label: D
options.text: Most patients present in the seventh or eight decade of life

questions.correct_answer: C. Patients are at high risk for the development of disseminated intravascular coagulation

questions.text: Which of the following findings would not be expected in the blast population of acute myeloid leukemia with monocytic differentiation?

A 70-years-old man presents with pancytopenia for six months. A bonemarrow is performed and shows dys plasia in the granulocyte, erythrocyte and megakaryocyte lineages. The blast count in the peripheral blood is less than 1% and the blast count in the bone marrow is less than 5%. The best diagnosis is:

options.label: D
options.text: Acute myeloid leukemia with myelodysplasia-related changes

questions.correct_answer: C. Myelodysplastic syndrome with multilineage dysplasia

questions.text: All of the following are features of accelerated phase of chronic my eloid leukemia, BCR-ABL1 positive,except:

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Presence of 20% basophils in the peripheral blood

questions.correct_answer: B. Presence of 20% blasts in the peripheral blood

A 48-years-old woman was admitted with a history of weakness for two months. On Examination, cervical lymph nodes were found enlarged and spleen was palpable 2 cm below the costal margin. Her haemoglobin was 10.5 g/dL, platelet count 2.7 x 109/L and total leukocyte count 40 x 109/L, which included 80% mature lymphoid cells with coarse clumped chroma tin. Bone marrow revealed a nodular lymphoid infiltrate. The peripheral blood lymphoid cells were positive for CD19, CD5, CD20 and CD23 and were negative for CD79 B and FMC-7. The Histopathological Examination of the lymph node in this patient will most likely exhibit effacement of lymph node architecture by

options.label: A
options.text: A pseudofollicular pattern with proliferation centers

options.label: B
options.text: A monomorphic lymphoid proliferation with a nodular pattern

options.label: D
options.text: A diffuse proliferation of medium to large lymphoid cells with high mitotic rate

questions.correct_answer: A. A pseudofollicular pattern with proliferation centers

questions.text: Which of the following molecular genetic abnormalities would be most likely to impart a poor prognosis in a patient with acute myeloid leukemia?
Which of the following antigens is not typically expressed in acute promyelocytic leukemia with PML-RARA?
On which chromosome is the retinoic acid receptor α gene located?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • C. 18q11.2: This is not the location of either the PML or RAR-α genes. There is no significant association of this chromosomal region with APL or the retinoic acid receptor gene.
  • • D. 11q13: This region is associated with other oncogenes in different cancers, but not with the retinoic acid receptor alpha (RAR-α) gene, which is located on chromosome 17q21

questions.correct_answer: D. Karyotype of the leukemic blasts
